greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Euclid-Mullin sequence (A000945) with initial value a(1)=8191 instead of a(1)=2.
link: Sean A. Irvine, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..59
mathematica: a[1]=8191; a[n_] := First[ Flatten[ FactorInteger[ 1+Product[ a[ j ], {j, 1, n-1} ] ] ] ]; Array[a, 10]
program: first(m)={my(v=vector(m)); v[1]=8191; for(i=2, m, v[i]=spf(1+prod(j=1, i-1, v[j]))); v;} /* _Anders Hellström_, Aug 18 2015 */
results.author: _Labos Elemer_
ext: More terms from _Sean A. Irvine_, Sep 20 2012
a(30)-a(38) from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 21 2012
